question: Evaluate $\tan 10^\circ \tan 20^\circ \tan 30^\circ \tan 40^\circ \tan 50^\circ \tan 60^\circ \tan 70^\circ \tan 80^\circ.$
answer:
Note that
\[\tan (90^\circ - x) \tan x = \frac{\sin (90^\circ - x)}{\cos (90^\circ - x)} \cdot \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} = \frac{\cos x}{\sin x} \cdot \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} = 1,\]so
\begin{align*}
&\tan 10^\circ \tan 20^\circ \tan 30^\circ \tan 40^\circ \tan 50^\circ \tan 60^\circ \tan 70^\circ \tan 80^\circ \\
&= (\tan 10^\circ \tan 80^\circ) (\tan 20^\circ \tan 70^\circ) (\tan 30^\circ \tan 60^\circ) (\tan 40^\circ \tan 50^\circ) \\
&= \boxed{1}.
\end{align*}
agents_response:
We know that $\tan(90^\circ - x) = \cot x$.

Therefore, the given expression can be written as:

$\tan 10^\circ \tan 20^\circ \tan 30^\circ \tan 40^\circ \tan 50^\circ \tan 60^\circ \tan 70^\circ \tan 80^\circ$

$= \cot 80^\circ \cot 70^\circ \cot 60^\circ \cot 50^\circ \cot 40^\circ \cot 30^\circ \cot 20^\circ \cot 10^\circ$

$= \cot 80^\circ \cdot \left(\cot 80^\circ \cdot \cot 70^\circ \right) \cdot \left(\cot 60^\circ \cdot \cot 50^\circ \right) \cdot \left(\cot 40^\circ\cdot \cot 30^\circ \right) \cdot \cot 20^\circ \cdot \cot 10^\circ$

$= \cot^2 80^\circ \cdot \cot^2 70^\circ \cdot \cot^2 60^\circ \cdot \cot^2 50^\circ \cdot \cot 40^\circ \cdot \cot 30^\circ \cdot \cot 20^\circ \cdot \cot 10^\circ$

We know that $\cot x \cdot \tan x = 1.$ Using this property, along with the fact that $\cot(90^\circ - x) = \tan x$, we get:

$\cot 80^\circ \cdot \cot 10^\circ = 1$

$\cot 70^\circ \cdot \cot 20^\circ = 1$

$\cot 60^\circ \cdot \cot 30^\circ = 1$

$\cot 50^\circ \cdot \cot 40^\circ = 1$

Therefore, the expression simplifies to:

$= \cot^2 80^\circ$

$= \boxed{1}$
